llm.feedback: Your draft mixes multiple data points but fails to map each scenario to a canonical handle, uses a non‑standard line format, and includes extraneous numeric fields that obscure the causal chain. Rewrite each “Up/Down” line as **Up/Down | Time window | Driver/Mechanism | What to watch | Probability %** and attach a single ID citation for the factual claim (e.g., “Fed September cut (Z7O1DCHS7)”). Ensure the driver directly links to the asset you’re targeting (spx, ust10y, etc.); for example, “Fed September cut → spx rise 3–5 % (FAN5RYW6T)”. Drop the malformed “Up | 1–3 months | 4,200 …” line entirely. Add a concise trade/outlook line: **Down | 3–6 mo | spx | Entry 4,200 | Stop 4,000 | Target 3,800 | R/R 2:1 | Invalidation Fed cut | Trigger Fed policy announcement | Prob 60 % | Conf 70** (or an equivalent up‑side trade). Keep the probability figures consistent with the source: 86 % for a September cut (Z7O1DCHS7), 20 % for a pause/hike (FAN5RYW6T), 40 % for tech earnings weakness (FAN5RYW6T), and 60 % for the 5–10 % decline scenario (FAN5RYW6T). Remove any non‑cited numbers or ambiguous references, and ensure every line ends with a single probability percentage.
